page.title: 02BLIND YEO RIVER.
page.content:
The{Blind Yeo River}runs from {Blagdon {Lake}to the {Bristol Channel}at the {West End of Clevedon.}It is called Blind because it does not run into { the sea.It has been blocked off and had its course recut to stop flooding. The baliff of the river told us that there are eels,perch,roach,pike,tench, bream,lamprey and dab in the slow running water. Millers thumb,stickle backs,rainbow trout,brown trout and goudgen prefer the medium flowing water. The most popular fish to catch is the {perch.
The baliffs job can be pleasant especially as most baliffs enjoy fishing themselves but the worst part is when someone is caught fishing without a licence and the courts can confiscate the fishing tackle.
